snippet: American bishops say they can feel change rattling the church hierarchy even if they do not yet understand where the pope is leading them.
abstract: American bishops of Roman Catholic Church hold annual fall meeting, and many say they feel change rattling church hierarchy; vast majority of bishops were appointed by Pope Francis's two more conservative predecessors, and some are resistant to kinds of changes Francis seems to envision.
lead_paragraph: American bishops say they can feel change rattling the church hierarchy even if they do not yet understand where the pope is leading them.

headline.main: U.S. Bishops Struggle to Follow Lead of Francis
headline.print_headline: U.S. Bishops Struggle to Follow Lead of Francis
